abstract: Two groups dropped lawsuits in which they contended that Google’s book-scanning in France violated copyright, and said they would offer digital versions of their works for Google to sell.
snippet: Two groups dropped lawsuits in which they contended that Google’s book-scanning in France violated copyright, and said they would offer digital versions of their works for Google to sell.
lead_paragraph: PARIS — Even as a dispute over Google’s digital book project deepens in the United States, the company said Monday that it had reached an agreement in France that could bring back to life thousands of out-of-print works.

headline.main: French Publisher Group Strikes Deal With Google Over E-Books
headline.print_headline: Google Has Deal in France For Book-Scanning Project
